member.summary: A Component which contains Booster stats.

member.name: P:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.BoosterComponent.Thrust
member.summary: Capacity for thrust using standard boost. A larger value allows for faster movement in the specified direction.

member.name: P:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.BoosterComponent.TuneMaxThrust
member.summary: The value the tune slider will set the mentioned stat to at the end of the slider, 50 FRS points in.

member.name: P:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.BoosterComponent.TuneEfficiencyThrust
member.summary: Whether or not putting FRS points into tuning the stat will change it or not.

member.name: P:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.BoosterComponent.QuickBoostDuration
member.summary: Only usable on Quick Booster stats. Length of time quick boost can be engaged. The larger this value, the further the AC can move during quick boost, but overall energy consumption will increase.

member.name: P:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.BoosterComponent.ThrustENCost
member.summary: Energy consumed when engaging thrust. Larger values indicate a greater EN cost requirement for use.

member.summary: The firing mode of the weapon determining how it behaves when it is fired.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.WeaponComponent.FiringMode.GUN
member.summary: The weapon can be fired by holding the trigger without needing to let go.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.WeaponComponent.FiringMode.MIS
member.summary: The weapon requires the trigger to be pressed each time it is fired.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.WeaponComponent.FiringMode.CAN
member.summary:
The weapon can be fired by holding the trigger without needing to let go.
The weapon goes into the ready position after pressing the firing button while standing still on ground.
The ready position lets the weapon fire faster and allows for wider attack angles.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.WeaponComponent.FiringMode.BLD
member.summary: The weapon is melee and lunges towards targets.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.AcParts4.WeaponComponent.FiringMode.PILE
member.summary: The weapon is melee and does not lunge.

member.name: T:SoulsFormats.BHD5
member.summary: The header file of the dvdbnd container format used to package all game files with hashed filenames.

member.name: T:SoulsFormats.BHD5.Game
member.summary: Indicates the format of a dvdbnd.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.BHD5.Game.DarkSouls1
member.summary:
Dark Souls 1, both PC and console versions.
The first known format of this header.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.BHD5.Game.DarkSouls2
member.summary:
Dark Souls 2 and Scholar of the First Sin on PC.
Includes AES encryption and salting.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.BHD5.Game.DarkSouls3
member.summary:
Dark Souls 3 and Sekiro on PC.
Includes size fields that identify how big the archive or its files are without padding.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.BHD5.Game.EldenRing
member.summary:
Elden Ring on PC.
Improves the size of many fields by making them 64-bit, changes the unpadded size fields to be 32-bit, and resorts some fields.

member.summary: Format the file should be written in.

member.name: T:SoulsFormats.BND2
member.summary:
A Binder2 archive.
Has been seen in the following games:
Metal Wolf Chaos
Another Century's Episode 2
Armored Core: Formula Front (PSP and PS2)
Armored Core: Nine Breaker
Armored Core: Last Raven (PS2 and PSP)
Build settings for a file of this format were found in Armored Core Formula Front PSP which mentioned an app named Binder2.

member.summary: DCP header, chunked deflate compression. Used in ACE:R TPFs.

member.summary: DCP header, deflate compression. Used in DeS test maps.

member.summary: DCX header, chunked deflate compression. Primarily used in DeS.

member.summary: DCX header, deflate compression. Primarily used in DS1 and DS2.

member.summary: DCX header, deflate compression. Primarily used in BB and DS3.

member.summary: DCX header, deflate compression. Used for the backup regulation in DS3 save files.

member.summary: DCX header, deflate compression. Used in Sekiro.

member.summary: DCX header, deflate compression. Used in the ER regulation.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.FLVER2.EdgeGeomSpuConfigInfo.GeomConfigFlags.StaticGeomFastPath
member.summary:
The SPU job will not modify input geometry.
This allows some functions in Edge to skip performing unnecessary work.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.FLVER2.EdgeGeomSpuConfigInfo.GeomConfigFlags.ExtraUniformTable
member.summary:
If a segment is using either culling or custom blend shape flavors, this flag is required.
Both of culling and custom blend shape flavors require another uniform table to store temporary data.
The size of the temporary uniform table has to be accounted for in the Edge partitioner when a segment is made.

member.summary: Indexes are in a triangle list with triangles wound clockwise, each index being an unsigned 16-bit integer.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.FLVER2.EdgeGeomSpuConfigInfo.EdgeGeomIndexes.TriangleListUShortCCW
member.summary: Indexes are in a triangle list with triangles wound counter-clockwise, each index being an unsigned 16-bit integer.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.FLVER2.EdgeGeomSpuConfigInfo.EdgeGeomIndexes.TriangleListCompressedCW
member.summary: Indexes are in a compressed triangle list with triangles wound clockwise.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.FLVER2.EdgeGeomSpuConfigInfo.EdgeGeomIndexes.TriangleListCompressedCCW
member.summary: Indexes are in a compressed triangle list with triangles wound counter-clockwise.

member.summary: The different supported skinning matrix formats.

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.FLVER2.EdgeGeomSpuConfigInfo.EdgeGeomSkinningMatrixFormat.RowMajor3x4
member.summary:
This is the native matrix type of edge and uses less memory than 4x4 matrices.
It has the top three rows of a 4x4 matrix that is “DirectX-style”.
The fourth row is not needed explicitly as it is always [0,0,0,1].

member.name: F:SoulsFormats.FLVER2.EdgeGeomSpuConfigInfo.EdgeGeomSkinningMatrixFormat.RowMajor4x4
member.summary: This matrix type is a “DirectX-style” row-major 4x4 matrix.

member.summary: This matrix type is a "OpenGL-style" column-major 4x4 matrix.

This variant is used in AC4 and ACFA.

member.name: P:SoulsFormats.MLB_AC4.IsAnimation

Models and animations both share the same value.
If there are no entries this cannot be determined properly.

member.summary: If this PARAMDEF is version aware, returns a filtered PARAMDEF with only the fields that are valid for a specific regulation version. member.summary: Reads an XML-formatted PARAMDEF from a file.
member.param: The path to read the PARAMDEF XML file from

If versionAware is enabled and the PARAMDEFs support it, additional data will be read such that the PARAMDEFs can be used on older regulations if the regulation version is known. Otherwise, the PARAMDEFs will be read to support the latest supported regulation version only.
Whether or not strict field validation occurs.

member.name: M:SoulsFormats.Headerizer.ReadPS5Images(SoulsFormats.BinaryReaderEx,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SoulsFormats.DDS.DXGI_FORMAT)
member.summary: The texture buffers for internal mipmaps seemingly subdivide by 2 each time we go down a mip, UNTIL we reach 0x400. When the buffer should be 0x400, we instead skip to 0x200. All mipmap buffers after this will be 0x100 regardless of true size. While the buffers are larger than the actual texture size, the swizzling happens at the BUFFER level and thus reading the full buffer for deswizzling is paramount

member.name: M:SoulsFormats.TPF.Write(SoulsFormats.BinaryWriterEx)
member.summary:
Writes TPF data to a BinaryWriterEx.
Comments from Natsu: SoulsFormats(originally) was padding to 4 The(console)textures pad to 0x80 SoulsFormats(originally) also did not include the extra padding on the last file which the vanilla console TPFs do for some reason, so I added that SoulsFormats(originally) also includes padding in the data size value in the header The vanilla TPFs do not, so I skipped adding padding to it

member.name: P:SoulsFormats.BinaryReaderEx.IsFlexible
member.summary: Skips various assertions in order to load a file despite potential mismatches. This is mainly a tool to circumvent malicious format hacking by modders who try to "obfuscate" their files. This should not be set to TRUE for most purposes unless you are extremely sure what you are doing.

member.summary: Loads a shared library with the specified filename and flag.
member.param: The name of the shared library to load.
The flag that specifies the behavior of the loading process. Default is 1 (RTLD_LAZY). RTLD_LAZY = 1, RTLD_NOW = 2, RTLD_GLOBAL = 256, RTLD_LOCAL = 0
member.returns: A handle to the loaded library, or IntPtr.Zero if the library could not be loaded.
